item.title: What A Long Strange Trip It's Been
item.description: Just over four years ago, I impulsively responded to a Facebook post about a devops evangelism role at a new tech startup. I had never been an evangelist and I knew nothing of the term “devops”. #yolo ¯_(ツ)_/¯ This spontaneous act illuminated a path of personal and professional growth. A path that created new opportunities for me almost daily. A path that changed me for the better. A path that wasn’t there… until it was.

item.title: Configure Deployment Option
item.description: Begin by selecting the “Choose Source” (Configure required settings) option Next select the correct source. I’m using GitHub, so that is the option I will choose: The next screen will prompt you to enter your GitHub account, project, branch, etc. Once you have made your configuration choices, select “Save” at the bottom of the screen. That’s it! Now, any time new code is pushed to your repository, Azure will automatically deploy the changes for you.

item.title: Deploy a Static HTML Site To Azure as a Web App
item.description: This tutorial will walk you through getting a static web site up and running as a Web App on Microsoft Azure. The site itself is stored in a GitHub repository: https://github.com/jasonhand/JasonHandCom The site is built using Hugo (gohugo.io) The tutorial does not cover Hugo specific topics but rather automatically pushing changes to a site up to the cloud (MS Azure) automatically once code has been committed to the repository. Open the Cloud Shell from within the Azure Portal
